BIODIVERSITY.INFO: Biodiversity is great for people and the planet. We count species richness from all known records of biodiversity on your farm from the boundaries of your fields. You can increase your biodiversity count on your farm by using the https://www.inaturalist.org/app.
BIODIVERSITY.TITLE: Biodiversity

INSIGHTS.INFO: Insights provides added data insights into what is happening on your farm. The more data you provide in the application, the more insights can be generated. See individual insights for further information.

LABOUR_HAPPINESS.INFO: We estimate the impact of different tasks on labour happiness by using the satisfaction scores and labour hours spent on each task from shifts.
LABOUR_HAPPINESS.TITLE: Labour Happiness

NITROGEN_BALANCE.CYCLE_INDICATOR: Your Nitrogen Balance is on a {{frequency}} months cycle and data will show on: {{refreshDate}}
NITROGEN_BALANCE.FIRST_TIME: It looks like it's your first time running this! Please select a frequency to calculate your nitrogen balance.
NITROGEN_BALANCE.INFO_1: The nitrogen balance tells you if you have applied too little or too much fertilizer. It relies on your harvest logs, nitrogen credits from legumes, and fertilization logs. You can run the balance on your desired time interval.
NITROGEN_BALANCE.INFO_2: Click the delete button to reset your schedule.
NITROGEN_BALANCE.TITLE: Nitrogen Balance

PEOPLE_FED.INFO: We estimate the number of potential meals provided by your farm based on sales data, and crop composition databases. We assume that daily requirements are divided equally across three meals a day.
PEOPLE_FED.TITLE: People Fed

PRICES.INFO: We show you the trajectory of your sales prices against the sales prices for the same goods within a given distance of you, collected across the LiteFarm network.
PRICES.NEARBY_FARMS: Pulling from {{count}} farm for sales data
PRICES.NEARBY_FARMS_plural: Pulling from {{count}} farms for sales data
PRICES.NO_ADDRESS: You currently do not have an address in LiteFarm. Please update it in your Profile to get nearby prices information!
PRICES.TITLE: Prices

SOIL_OM.INFO: Soil Organic Matter is needed to maintain a healthy soil environment for your crop. We populate these data from your most recent soil analysis logs. If you do not have any data we predict the potential soil organic matter for your location globally.
SOIL_OM.TITLE: Soil OM

INSIGHTS.TITLE: Insights

WATER_BALANCE.FIRST_TIME: Looks like this is your first time running this! For more info on what this does, please click the information button to see.
WATER_BALANCE.INFO_1: The water balance tells you whether your crops have too little or too much water. It relies on weather data, and it is updated by your irrigation and soil texture data from your soil analysis logs.
WATER_BALANCE.INFO_2: This feature has not been widely tested across farms with low surrounding weather station density so use with caution. We welcome feedback on how well it performs for your farm.
WATER_BALANCE.NO_SCHEDULE_RUN: Your scheduled water balance hasn't run yet, please check back in two days and ensure you have at least one soil analysis that records soil texture for a field to see water balance data for crops in that field. If the problem persists please contact LiteFarm.
WATER_BALANCE.TITLE: Water Balance

ESTIMATED_REVENUE.CALCULATION_DESCRIPTION: We calculate estimated revenue using the end date of crops estimated in the fields module. To include a crop in your estimated revenue calculation make sure you capture its end date within your financial report end date.
ESTIMATED_REVENUE.TITLE: Estimated Revenue

EXPENSE_DETAIL.TEMP_DELETE_CONFIRMATION: Are you sure you want to delete this expenses?
EXPENSE_DETAIL.TITLE: Expense Detail

FINANCES.BALANCE_EXPLANATION: We compute a real-time balance (‘cost of production’) for each crop on your farm. This is a simple equation of expenses minus revenue.  Expenses for each crop are calculated from two parts, one part is the labour expenses from hours logged for farm activities, the other part is from the other expenses logged for the whole farm. Where expenses are logged for the whole farm we equally divide them amongst the crops on the farm. Unallocated means that a shift(s) has been submitted for a field when there is not a crop yet on that field. This shift(s) will be assigned to crops as they are added to that field within the financial reporting time window.
FINANCES.ENSURE_ONE_CROP_WARNING: Please ensure that at least 1 crop and an associated sale or shift has been allocated to see this information.
FINANCES.HAS_UNALLOCATED_LINE1: *Unallocated means that work has been done on an empty field for the selected date range.

FINANCES.HAS_UNALLOCATED_LINE2: If one or more crops were added to an empty field later and there exists a shift related to the crops, then the work done on that empty field will be evenly distributed to each crop.
